info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 13 at 8:19PM PDT by NWS Portland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Multnomah and southeastern Clark Counties through 845 PM PDT... At 818 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Hazelwood, or 7 miles southwest of Washougal, moving northeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Storm is showing very weak rotation which may produce a brief funnel cloud. If a funnel cloud is witnessed, notify local law enforcement and ask to relay to the National Weather Service. Locations impacted include... Washougal, Portland, Gresham, Camas, Troutdale, Hazelwood, Powellhurst-Centennial, Fairview, Wood Village and Rockwood. In Washington this includes State Route 14 between mile markers 11 and 21. This includes the following highways in Oregon... Interstate 84 between mile markers 12 and 20. U.S. Highway 26 east of Portland near mile marker 9. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
